Fractured Thoughts

Tense room, Raskolnikov and Sonia, emotional turmoil  
Raskolnikov: “How can this shame exist with holy feelings?”  

Sonia: “But what would become of them?”  

Raskolnikov: “Leap into the water and end it all!”  

---  

Sonia gazes at Raskolnikov, anguish in her eyes  
Raskolnikov: “You’ve thought of this before, haven’t you?”  

Sonia: “I... I just can’t.”  

Raskolnikov: “What stops you from ending it?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with Sonia's enduring shame and despair, questioning how she can maintain her humanity amidst her degrading circumstances.
